We offer graduate programmes to develop your specialist knowledge and skills, relevant to the industry.
We've simplified the application process, clarified our assessment criteria and provided tips on presenting your best self.
Shortlist the programmes that reflect your interests and expertise and demonstrate your passion and aptitude for your chosen programme through a written application and an interview.
There are two admission intakes per academic year in September and January.
Master of Science in Civil Engineering
Master of Science in Electrical and Electronic Engineering
Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering
There are three admission intakes per academic year, in September, January and May.
Master of Clinical Research in Health Sciences
Doctor of Clinical Research in Health Sciences
It's more than grades and test scores. It's about who you are, what you're curious about, what excites you, what you've done, and what you'd love to do.
Are you academically proficient in your chosen field?
Have you worked in a related industry?
What traits will make you a fit for your programme?

during the application period below. If this is your first time using the portal, here is a
on how to register via the application portal.
For postgraduate programmes by research, interested applicants are required to complete the Research Collaboration Agreement (RCA) before applying for admission. Please contact us at
For applicants who are interested in the September intake:
(Master of Science in Electrical and Electronic Engineering and Master of Science of Mechanical Engineering)
Payment of application fee and online submission of relevant supporting documents
To be completed within one week after the admission deadline
For applicants who are interested in the January intake:
Payment of application fee and online submission of relevant supporting documents
To be completed within one week after the admission deadline
(Master of Science in Electrical and Electronic Engineering and Master of Science of Mechanical Engineering)

We help committed students facing financial difficulties through a range of financial assistance schemes. These include loans, bursaries, study grants, and emergency funds.

The SIT campus experience reaches far beyond the classroom. It explores who you are through sports and culture, and helps you build connections, friendships and networks that will enrich your life and future career.

article_texts:
Postgraduate Admissions
We offer graduate programmes to develop your specialist knowledge and skills, relevant to the industry.
We've simplified the application process, clarified our assessment criteria and provided tips on presenting your best self.
Shortlist the programmes that reflect your interests and expertise and demonstrate your passion and aptitude for your chosen programme through a written application and an interview.
Postgraduate Admissions
Programmes by Coursework
There are two admission intakes per academic year in September and January.

How we assess you
It's more than grades and test scores. It's about who you are, what you're curious about, what excites you, what you've done, and what you'd love to do.

chevron--up
Application Period
Interested applicants can apply via the
SIT Postgraduate Application Portal
during the application period below. If this is your first time using the portal, here is a
user guide
on how to register via the application portal.
For postgraduate programmes by research, interested applicants are required to complete the Research Collaboration Agreement (RCA) before applying for admission. Please contact us at
PPR@SingaporeTech.edu.sg
before submitting your application online.
For applicants who are interested in the September intake:
Online application period
13 Jan to 31 Mar 2025
(Master of Health Sciences)
15 May to 9 Jun 2025
(Master of Science in Electrical and Electronic Engineering and Master of Science of Mechanical Engineering)
Payment of application fee and online submission of relevant supporting documents
To be completed within one week after the admission deadline

Sep 2025

To be completed within one week after the admission deadline
